Description:
Job DescriptionOur Mission is to Simplify Life. We are looking to Simplify and automate complex decision-making for customer centric industries, like Utilities, Financial Services, Logistics, and commerce, that drive the world's economies and you have the chance to join the revolution. We are trying to solve huge challenges in today's enterprise that are directly impacting the employee and customer experience.What can we promise you:You’ll join a global family of awesome, passionate people that are working together to build a sustainable, scalable ecosystem committed to using logic to create a better experience.
We want you to help us become better. You will be empowered to drive change and innovate.
That we will invest in you. We will give you the opportunity to master your domain and drive excellence.Job Summary:As the Culture & Happiness Associate at Avertra, you will be working closely with the CEO and Chief Of Staff to maintain the organization’s culture. You will be the ambassador for the workforce’s mindset and set of beliefs.Job Responsibilities:Employee Relations:Act as an active listener to employees to become the liaison between employee welfare and executive management. 
Cultivate a relationship among employees as well as other executives.
Plan and carry out events and team-building initiatives for our global workforce.
Oversee, manage, and document employee conflicts and grievances.
Travel to global Avertra sites to build personal relationships with employees.Employee Mindset:Plan and execute employee sessions and workshops for our global workforce about topics that align with Avertra’s core values and cultural beliefs.
Work with Learning & Development to ensure that core Avertra values are central to the company’s training, and assessment mechanisms.
Plan and execute strategies around optimizing communication within the organization at every level and intersection.Employee Experience:Carry out diversity and inclusion programs to meet the company’s equity objectives.
Ensure that the company’s policies and procedures are in line with the company’s corporate values and beliefs.
Ensure that all employee touchpoints are optimized and in line with cultural best practices.
Ensure organizational transparency with employees.
Present model behavior to employees in terms of excellence and conduct to set an example.Employee Engagement:Ignite thought leadership projects in the organization to promote innovative thinking within the culture. 
Communicate the company’s culture-related goals to the organization.
Conduct 1:1 interviews with employees to gauge feedback on cultural initiatives.Culture and Branding:Oversee Avertra’s employer branding by collaborating with Talent Management and Marketing.
Work with Avertra employees to enhance their personal brands.Employee Strategy, Insights, and Analytics:Create and carry out employee happiness and satisfaction surveys, which will then be turned into tracker reports to provide insight to executive management and produce points of action.
Track key metrics such as turnover rate, retention rate, tenure, etc., and maintain the KPIs associated.
Conduct a trend analysis for turnover to produce points of action.
Conduct competitor comparison reports to compare Avertra’s employee experience in relation to its competitors, as well as to stay up to date with industry trends.
Create and carry out the strategy and roadmap set for Avertra.
Oversee and maintain Avertra’s value book, and ensure implementation by promoting the values and ensuring that deliberate hiring takes place to ensure “culture fits” with new hires.
Work with the People division to ensure that incentives and benefits are competitive.Skills
Skills:
Good and clear communication skills.
Leadership skills.
Analytical skills.
Problem-solving skills.
Presentation skills
A bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Psychology, or Sociology.
3+ years of experience in a People & Culture role, HR role, or Marketing role.

Good and clear communication skills.
Analytical and problem-solving skills.
Native or excellent written and verbal English skills are a hard must.

Experience in the technology industry.
Holder of an MBA.
Preferably holder of an American or EU passport.
Local Jordanian office hours with flexibility.
